# Today: objectives & schedule  

**In this module we aim to help you:**  
* Practice using {janitor} to quickly create simple tabulations  
* Practice using {dplyr} to summarise data with versatility  
* Practice using {gtsummary} to make publication-ready tables  
* Make tables of printable quality and export as PNG, Word, etc.  

```{r, echo=FALSE, warning=F, message=F}

  "15 minutes",  "Review of previous module",
  "30 minutes", "Approaches for grouping and summarizing data",
  "45 minutes", "Demo & Exercise: janitor",
  "45 minutes", "Demo & Exercise: dplyr",
  "45 minutes", "Demo & Exercise: gtsummary",
  "30 minutes", "Plenary debrief & flextable demo")

outline %>% 
  flextable::qflextable() %>%
```

# Functions  

Common grouping/summarising functions, all from the {tidyverse}:  

* `count()`  
* `group_by()`  
* `summarise()`  
* `arrange()`  




---
# `count()`  

Pipe the data into to `count()`, and provide a column name.  

This returns the number of rows per unique value (per group)  

--


```{r, echo=T}
surv %>% 
  count(hospital)                            #<<
```

???
Very quick and fast


---
# `count()`  

You can include multiple grouping columns  

--

```{r, echo=T}
surv %>% 
  count(hospital, sex)                            #<<
```

???
Very quick and fast


---
# group_by() and summarise()  

But what if you want more than just the counts?  

--

"What is mean age in each group?"   

--

"What is the latest date of symptom onset in each group?"  

--

"What is the number of deaths among males in each group?"   

--

`group_by()` and `summarise()` together allow the flexibility to create a **new, summary data frame** with **statistics by group**.   


.footnote[`summarise()` and `summarize()` are equivalent]  




---
# group_by() and summarise()  

```{r, echo=T, eval=F}
surv %>% 
  group_by(hospital)
```

No perceptible change to the dataset *until* another {dplyr} function is applied.  

--

If printed, the `Groups:` are listed above the data.

```{r, echo=F, eval=T}
surv %>% 
  group_by(hospital)
```



???
Note the `groups: hospital`, at the top of the tibble




---
# group_by() and summarise()  

Within `summarise()`, *create columns in a **new**, summarized dataset.*   

--

```{r, results = "asis", echo = FALSE}
str_glue("summarise(new column name = a function to apply to each group of rows)") %>%
  flair("new column name", color = "deeppink") %>%
  flair("a function", color = "cornflowerblue") %>%
  flair_all(before = "<h4>", after = "</h4>") %>%
  cat()
```

--

```{r summarise, include = F}
surv %>% 
  group_by(hospital) %>% 
  summarise()   
```

```{r summarise_flair, echo=F}
decorate("summarise") %>%
  flair("n_rows", color = "deeppink") %>%
  flair("n()", color = "cornflowerblue") %>% 
  knit_print()
```

# group_by() and summarise()  

Within the parentheses, *list new columns for the **new**, summary dataset.*  

```{r, results = "asis", echo = FALSE}
str_glue("summarise(new column name = a function to apply to each group of rows)") %>%
  flair("new column name", color = "deeppink") %>%
  flair("a function", color = "cornflowerblue") %>%
  flair_all(before = "<h4>", after = "</h4>") %>%
  cat()
```

```{r summarise3_en, include = F}
surv %>% 
  group_by(hospital) %>% 
  summarise(
    n_rows  = n(),                               # n() counts the number of rows per group
    age_avg = mean(age_years, na.rm = T))        # mean age in the group
```

```{r summarise3_fr, include = F}
surv %>% 
  group_by(hospital) %>% 
  summarise(
    n_rows  = n(),                               # n(): le nombre de lignes par groupe

```

```{r summarise3_ru, include = F}
surv %>% 
  group_by(hospital) %>%

    n_rows  = n(),                               #n() подсчитывает количество строк для каждой группы
    age_avg = mean(age_years, na.rm = T))        # средний возраст в группе
```

```{r summarise3_es, include = F}
surv %>%

  summarise(
```

# group_by() and summarise()  

Within the parentheses, *create columns in a **new**, summarized dataset.*  

```{r, results = "asis", echo = FALSE}
str_glue("summarise(new column name = a function to apply to each group of rows)") %>%
  flair("new column name", color = "deeppink") %>%
  flair("a function", color = "cornflowerblue") %>%
  flair_all(before = "<h4>", after = "</h4>") %>%
  cat()
```

```{r summarise4_en, include = F}
surv %>% 
  group_by(hospital) %>% 
  summarise(
    n_rows  = n(),                               # n() counts the number of rows per group

    max_onset = max(date_onset, na.rm=T))        # latest onset date

```

```{r summarise4_fr, include = F}
    max_onset = max(date_onset, na.rm=T))        # date d'apparition la plus récente

```

# group_by() and summarise()  

Within the parentheses, *create columns in a **new**, summarized dataset.*   

```{r, results = "asis", echo = FALSE}
str_glue("summarise(new column name = a function to apply to each group of rows)") %>%
  flair("new column name", color = "deeppink") %>%
  flair("a function", color = "cornflowerblue") %>%
  flair_all(before = "<h4>", after = "</h4>") %>%
  cat()
```

```{r summarise5_en, include = F}
surv %>% 
  group_by(hospital) %>% 
  summarise(
    n_rows  = n(),                               # n() counts the number of rows per group
    age_avg = mean(age_years, na.rm = T),        # mean age in the group
    max_onset = max(date_onset, na.rm=T),        # latest onset date
    n_female = sum(sex == 'female', na.rm=T)) # number female in group

```


```{r summarise5_fr, include = F}
surv %>% 
  group_by(hospital) %>% 
  summarise(
    n_rows  = n(),                               # n(): le nombre de lignes par groupe
    age_avg = mean(age_years, na.rm = T),        # âge moyen dans le groupe
    max_onset = max(date_onset, na.rm=T),        # date d'apparition la plus récente
    n_female = sum(sex == 'female', na.rm=T)) # nombre de femmes dans le groupe

```


```{r summarise5_ru, include = F}
surv %>% 
  group_by(hospital) %>% 
  summarise(
    n_rows  = n(),                               # n() подсчитывает количество строк в группе
    age_avg = mean(age_years, na.rm = T),        # средний возраст в группе
    max_onset = max(date_onset, na.rm=T),        # последняя дата начала заболевания
    n_female = sum(sex == 'female', na.rm=T)) ## количество женщин в группе

```
```{r summarise5_es, include = F}
surv %>% 
  group_by(hospital) %>% 
  summarise(
    n_rows  = n(),                               # n() cuenta el número de filas por grupo
    age_avg = mean(age_years, na.rm = T),        # edad media del grupo
    max_onset = max(date_onset, na.rm=T),        # Fecha de inicio más tardía
    n_female = sum(sex == 'female', na.rm=T)) # número de mujeres en el grupo

```


# group_by() and summarise()  

Within the parentheses, *create columns in a **new**, summarized dataset.*   

```{r, results = "asis", echo = FALSE}
str_glue("summarise(new column name = a function to apply to each group of rows)") %>%
  flair("new column name", color = "deeppink") %>%
  flair("a function", color = "cornflowerblue") %>%
  flair_all(before = "<h4>", after = "</h4>") %>%
  cat()
```

```{r summarise6_en, include = F}
surv %>% 
  group_by(hospital) %>% 
  summarise(
    n_rows  = n(),                                # n() counts the number of rows per group
    age_avg = mean(age_years, na.rm = T),        # mean age in the group
    max_onset = max(date_onset, na.rm=T),        # latest onset date
    n_female = sum(sex == 'female', na.rm=T), # number female in group
    pct_female = percent(n_female / n_rows))     # percent female in group
```


# `arrange()`

Sort the table by placing the column(s) for sorting within `arrange()`  

```{r, echo = params$lang == "en", eval = params$lang == "en"}
surv %>% 
  group_by(hospital) %>% 
  summarise(
    n_rows  = n(),                               # n() counts the number of rows per group
    age_avg = mean(age_years, na.rm = T),        # mean age in the group
    max_onset = max(date_onset, na.rm=T),        # latest onset date
    n_female = sum(sex == 'female', na.rm=T), # number female in group
    pct_female = percent(n_female / n_rows)) %>% # percent female in group
```

# flextable

```{r dplyr-flex-en, echo=params$lang == "en", eval = params$lang == "en"}
  group_by(hospital) %>% 
  summarise(
    n_rows  = n(),                               # n() counts the number of rows per group
    age_avg = mean(age_years, na.rm = T),        # mean age in the group
    max_onset = max(date_onset, na.rm=T),        # latest onset date
    n_female = sum(sex == 'female', na.rm=T), # number female in group
    pct_female = percent(n_female / n_rows)) %>% # percent female in group
```
